steps.title: Launch & land on Dashboard
details: All 5 tests open http://localhost:5173 successfully, but screenshots already show style inconsistencies (button styling, typography, spacing).

steps.title: Open “Add Task” modal
details: User clicks the Add Task FAB/ button. Modal appears in every run. Early UI-review flags: mis-aligned labels, cramped spacing, uneven padding.

steps.title: Fill in Task details
details: Typing Task Name, Description, Deadline, Categories generally works.
Repeated visual issues: labels mis-aligned, missing 'Select Categories' label, inconsistent font sizes, low colour contrast.

steps.title: Choose Colour
details: In 2 runs (Add New Task, Mark Task as done) the flow halts because the Colour section / picker cannot be located.

steps.title: Submit via “Create Task” button
details: 3 runs (Drag & Move Task, Pin a Task, Mark Task as Not Done) time-out trying to click Create Task.
Root cause surfaced in logs: category dropdown pop-over is left open and intercepts the pointer, blocking the button.

steps.title: Post-creation actions (emoji, pin, drag, mark done/not-done)
details: Because the task is never created, all subsequent steps stay in ‘pending’.

emotional_arc: Starts confident (dashboard loads quickly) → mild annoyance (layout looks slightly “off”) → rising frustration (modal feels cluttered / labels mis-aligned) → blocked & confused (can’t find Colour picker) → outright frustration / mistrust (Create Task button unresponsive) → abandonment (user gives up before any advanced task-management features).

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Crowded or mis-aligned forms feel sloppy and hurt scannability, slowing data entry.
next_actions: Add a base 8-pt spacing scale and apply through theme / CSS vars.
Audit flex/grid layouts in the modal – align labels and inputs in consistent columns.
Add automatic visual regression tests for spacing.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Missing or mis-placed labels (“Select Categories”, “Task Deadline”) force users to guess what a field is for; accessibility suffers.
next_actions: Ensure every input has an explicit <label> element linked via for / id.
Use consistent typography tokens for titles, labels, helper text.
Run an a11y checker (axe, Lighthouse) on the modal.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent sizes and styles damage brand trust and make CTAs harder to spot.
next_actions: Define primary / secondary button variants in the design system; replace ad-hoc class names.
Add hover / focus states that meet WCAG contrast.
Include buttons in a component snapshot test.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Flow blocks completely when Colour section is missing; inconsistent colours violate brand guidelines.
next_actions: Make Colour picker a required, always-rendered component (or gracefully hide step).
Provide default colour if user skips picker.
Validate brand palette in CSS variables.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Open dropdown menu intercepts clicks on “Create Task”, causing timeouts and user confusion.
next_actions: Close category menu on selection or on outside click.
Trap focus within modal; pressing ‘Esc’ should close sub-menus first.
Write e2e test: select category then click Create Task → should succeed.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Uneven font sizes/weights make hierarchy unclear and impair readability.
next_actions: Adopt type scale (e.g., 14 / 16 / 20 / 24).
Set base line-height and apply via theme.
Run design QA checklist before merge.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast text fails WCAG AA, impacting users with low vision.
next_actions: Run automated contrast linting.
Adjust palette to achieve 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text.
Offer dark-mode toggle only when colours are fixed.

first_tackles.description: Fix dropdown pop-over intercepting “Create Task” clicks – auto-close menu on selection or outside-click.
Re-enable / surface Colour picker section so flow can complete (or make it optional).
Standardise spacing & label alignment in the Add Task modal via a simple CSS grid / stack component.
Create shared button component with brand-approved styles and apply to Add Task & Create Task buttons.
Add automated a11y & visual regression tests (axe + chromatic) to catch label, contrast and spacing issues before shipping.
